snippet: Abu Yahya al-Libi, the Al Qaeda commander who escaped American custody in 2005, was either killed or seriously wounded after a drone strike in Pakistan’s tribal belt, according to tribal sources.
abstract: Pakistani tribal sources say that Abu Yahya al-Libi, the Al Qaeda commander who escaped American custody in 2005, has been either killed or seriously wounded by a drone attack in Pakistan's tribal belt; officials in Washington confirm that Libi was the target of the strike.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from Islamabad, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Abu Yahya al-Libi, the Al Qaeda commander who escaped American custody in 2005, was either killed or seriously wounded after a drone strike in Pakistan’s tribal belt, according to tribal sources.

headline.seo: Qaeda Deputy Targeted in Drone Strike in Pakistan
headline.main: Qaeda Deputy Targeted in Drone Strike in Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Drone Strike in Pakistan’s Tribal Belt Targets Al Qaeda’s No. 2 Commander

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
